result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerrianne M Paulson

defendant.name: Paulson, Kerrianne M

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Kerrianne M Paulson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF111 - Defendant plead not guilty, clerk directed to enter not guilty pleas into the record. Waives reading of the information. 

22CF124 -  Defendant plead not guilty, clerk directed to enter not guilty pleas into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:55 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson in court.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Kerrianne M Paulson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF11, 22CF112, 22CF124, 22CF135

9:57 AM Breakout room 
10:08 AM Court resumes. 


22CF135 Initial Appearance; Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

22CF111 & 22CF124 Preliminary Hearing

1W - Officer Wallin, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Attorney Steiner sent in 22CF124 incident report to Attorney Wynes for review. 
Exhibit #1 Incident Report -  M, O, R 
Cross by Attorney Wynes

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Attorney Wynes waives argument and objects to bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Wynes requests another day for an arraignment for 22CF111 & 22CF124

22CF112 and 22CF135 will be set for Status Hearings.
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:00 AM Case called - appearances stated.  Cases 22CF124, 22CF112, and 22CF111 called together
Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson in court.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes (22CF111 & 22CF124) appeared by video for Kerrianne M Paulson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

as to Case 22CF124: - INITIAL APPEARANCE
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding

Atty. Wynes states she has been appointed for 22CF111 and 22CF124 - conflicted out in 22CF112

Court states Preliminary hearings can be scheduled in 22CF111 and 22CF124
Atty Wynes waives time limits

Court schedules preliminary hearings in cases 22CF111 & 22CF124 

Court determines initial appearances need to be held in cases 22CF111 & 22CF112 after4 Atty. Wynes leaves call 

as to Case 22CF111 - INITIAL APPEARANCE
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding

as to Case 22CF112 - INITIAL APPEARANCE
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Charlotte M Wynes

1:01 PM Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson appeared by video.  Attorney Trevor A. Paulson appeared by video for Kerrianne M Paulson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22GF193
State is heard on bond. State requests bond be set at $800.00 cash. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Attorney Paulson is heard. Requests a signature bond. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Bonds in 22CF111 and 22CF112 will not be modified at this time. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:31 AM Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests a warrant. 
Court orders a warrant and for defendant to be held for further hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:23 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M. Paulson appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     D.A. waiting for additional reports before filing complaint; no objection to adjusting to a signature bond, but requests an Initial Appearance along with other cases.
     Court leaves the bond as set; advised of right to an atty.
     Court concludes at 2:27 p.m.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:26 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M. Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $150.00 cash bond. Standard Conditions. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a $150.00 cash bond. Standard Conditions. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
